## 1️⃣ What a **transversal** really is

| **Two (or more) lines** that are *separate* (they don’t all meet at one point) | ![two lines with a third crossing them](https://i.imgur.com/6G6vK5W.png) | The third line that *cuts across* the other two is the **transversal**. |

> **Key point:** A transversal **does not** have to pass through a single common point with the other lines. It meets each of the other lines at a **different** point.

## 1️⃣ How many angles are really there?

```

     /\  \
    /  \  \
   /    \  \
```

Because you have **two** such intersections (one with the top horizontal line, one with the bottom horizontal line), the total number of angles is **4 × 2 = 8**.

So we’ll end up with eight angles, not six.
